tweets.text:
Another major @EnvAgencyNW pumping operation being set-up at Ince Marshes pumping station following #StormChristoph  Area teams & national pump specialists working together with s/c partners @GroundControlGC & @Wheelers_Trans  
#whataweek #whatateam #teamworkmakesthedreamwork https://t.co/J4wfHBMDdW
We've been hard at work setting up pumps to remove flood water at Didsbury this morning. https://t.co/r0lxUkhbeH

tweets.text:
We still have many #flood alerts & warnings in place across the #Midlands this morning (Monday) especially on the #Severn & #Trent. Please keep checking your #flood risk #floodaware
https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/MSsvEWoTwD

We have closed the Hull Tidal Surge Barrier tonight at low tide to help reduce water levels in the #RiverHull. The 212 tonne steel gate will prevent tidal water entering the River Hull, creating additional space to drain river water. https://t.co/sPqrXyqZ6r

@metoffice @BhamCityCouncil @EnvAgencyMids Police say "the roads are absolutely horrendous" and officers have already been to four collisions across the motorway network #HeartNews (üì∏ @CMPG) https://t.co/AFkDsE5PbG

Photos showing the extent of the #floods around #Worcester. #Flood warnings remain in place please stay safe. Latest info is here 
https://t.co/wF5EVgdLXB https://t.co/SuPrRNu8WB

Another busy day for #TeamEA in the @EnvAgencyYNE patch. We‚Äôve had teams out refuelling our High Volume Pumps which remain operational where required. We‚Äôve also been receiving and dispatching lots of equipment from Selby Depot with the help of our specialist haulage contractors. https://t.co/vXniVjx28t
@LilianGreenwood the river gage at Clifton bridge has stopped working https://t.co/py34GwGPBY

tweets.text:
We‚Äôre operating the #Hull Barrier at low tides again today. We normally close it to reduce #flood risk from a tidal surge, but we‚Äôre using it this weekend to reduce river levels upstream on the #RiverHull

Find latest info about #FloodWarnings at https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/6sk0vJwc6X

tweets.text: The #TeamEA JTeam! - Joe & Jonathan, our @EnvAgencyNW Pump Operatives doing a fantastic job at one of the Didsbury Flood Storage Reservoir pumping sites. They‚Äôll be on until 10 tonight when the night shift come on so we can pump 24 hours a day. https://t.co/M9W6sfrmAg

@vivianne005 @ConnorPR @EnvAgency @ShropCouncil @FloodForum @FloodArkLimited @FloodArk We now have to wait for different consultants to come back to us for quotes on work. Could have avoided being flooded again had we carried out work that our consultant recommended 10 months ago!

A huge thank-you has gone out to all those who helped overnight to prevent major flooding @RyedaleDC @EnvAgencyYNE @NorthYorksFire @northyorkscc @scarrescue @yorkslincshmcg @dinahkeal @keanedunk @kevinhollinrake @PaulEmberley https://t.co/fXySKAGUeO

@TraffordCouncil @EnvAgencyNW @Ameyplc Timperley basin is blocked with debris after the recent rise in water levels @altrinchamtoday #timperleybrook https://t.co/vBPI9SsTL4

@metoffice @BhamCityCouncil @EnvAgencyMids More councils across the region are confirming that schools will be closed today:

Hundreds are shut in Worcestershire ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/jk5upnwASP

More than 60 are fully closed in Staffordshire ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/52wbo7zTVd

#HeartNews

Flooding at Lunt Meadows where the River Alt embankment collapsed on Wednesday. The embankment collapse protected hundreds of people in Maghull. This will happen again and government must reconsider it‚Äôs rejection of funding bids by @EnvAgency https://t.co/haEWuEzjwB

tweets.text: As flood waters continue to recede, we‚Äôve been able to release water from some washlands. These are temporary storage areas that help reduce flooding downstream. Here you can see water from Clifton Ings returning to the #RiverOuse https://t.co/CJO4PQQg3f

tweets.text:
Linda,

Thanks for your kind words. Yes, a big job, but thousands and thousands of properties protected. 

Grateful to other agencies, and public using our free-and-easy flood alerts system, never more needed than last week: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn
#floodaware 
Take care! Peter https://t.co/ea06NYDsXY

@sharon_gibbard @LangarAid @RaviSinghKA @Khalsa_Aid @EnvAgencyMids @ITVWales @nspauk @SikhPA @live_coventry @MarcusRashford @covobservernews Thank you so much, my first hot meal in 3 very long days x https://t.co/seTI5Labn2

tweets.text:
Our team are on their way to #Bewdley to provide hot food and refreshments to the local public and emergency services affected by the #floods and #snow 

@RaviSinghKA @Khalsa_Aid @EnvAgencyMids @ITVWales @nspauk @SikhPA @live_coventry @MarcusRashford @covobservernews https://t.co/H2t8xtk2GM

Brilliant example by @EnvAgencyYNE of using a tidal defence asset to exclude the tide to make room for incoming fluvial water reducing upstream river flooding.

This clever thinking shows how to make the most out of existing FCRM assets & perhaps better justify new ones. üìèüìêüåä https://t.co/cAbA0wufEc

urls.title: Swathes of England's vital flood defences ‚Äòalmost useless‚Äô
urls.description: Data from Environment Agency shows thousands of people and businesses ‚Äòat risk from ruined assets‚Äô

tweets.text:
In Greater Manchester 271 flood defences are in a state of disrepair. That's 12% of the total. But which ones are they?
Good investigation by @UE but can you not release more detail at local authority and installation level? We should know. @EnvAgencyNW  https://t.co/704nnqVBFj https://t.co/Ufm0FGuVnA

In Greater Manchester 271 flood defences are in a state of disrepair. That's 12% of the total. But which ones are they?
Good investigation by @UE but can you not release more detail at local authority and installation level? We should know. @EnvAgencyNW  https://t.co/704nnqVBFj https://t.co/Ufm0FGuVnA

Our teams have been working 24/7 to help communities affected by #StormChristoph. Thanks to all our tireless colleagues on the ground for all their hard work, we‚Äôve protected thousands of homes from flooding. #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/YXQaxoevsW

I have data from a survey, interviews and focus groups of almost 300 farmers where 90% indicated they are NOT willing to pay towards advice which is currently free at the point of delivery. Time to get some of that data published I think! @EnvAgency @NFUtweets @FarmersWeekly https://t.co/RopsokkzPV
@metoffice @BhamCityCouncil There are still more than 30 @EnvAgencyMids flood warnings in place along the River Severn through Worcestershire and Shropshire #HeartNews https://t.co/TjJhZaKfPJ

tweets.text:
Quagga mussels are an invasive non-native species and have recently been found in the #RiverTrent.

They can spread rapidly and block pipes.

Help us prevent this: check, clean and dry your equipment and footwear after spending time around watercourses. 
https://t.co/yvjXsvp14v https://t.co/xuYv9GXUrF

tweets.text: Busy few days for us attending #flooding in #York and #Malton. Providing support with our #Swiftwater rescue and #HighVolumePump. It‚Äôs a big multiagency response protecting the people of North Yorkshire. @NorthYorksFire @HVPCapability @EnvAgencyYNE https://t.co/2xKbtD32IB

urls.title: Waste collection cancellation - 25 January 2021
urls.description: Snowfall over the weekend and forecasts for further adverse weather means that all bin collections scheduled in Birmingham tomorrow (25 January 2021) have been cancelled.

tweets.text: @metoffice All waste collections in Birmingham have also been cancelled today. @BhamCityCouncil say they'll try and catch up during the week https://t.co/l5M3DLI5dx #HeartNews https://t.co/43WUtJNzE4

Joining @spanswicktweets for Breakfast on @BBCYork around 08:20 tomorrow to talk about our emergency flood work in Norton on Friday evening.  Picture shows us with @yorkslincshmcg @EnvAgencyYNE 
Our raft was bought for us by @No1Rotary  and @dalbydasher after 2015 York floods https://t.co/6roIlmHLLN

tweets.text: My latest stop today was at #Croston #Lancashire where I found Amber & Lynn from @EnvAgencyNW field teams overseeing the operation of our #flood storage basin. #incidents #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/Ap9yeq1xTW

We've had reports that piping and road closure cones were moved by members of the public last night.  @EnvAgencyYNE and @ryedaledc have called for people to stay clear of pumps and pipes and respect road closures for the sake of all.  https://t.co/gzHI5RpSGA

This is not right @EnvAgency @thameswater @SE_Rivers_Trust the next round of outfall aims and plans surely can't be based on these kind of calculations @LDNWaterkeeper? As the predictive models will just keep allowing things to get worse. https://t.co/87pjoYBKTH

@SayNo2SizewellC @KwasiKwarteng @The_ONR @EnvAgency plus huge CO2 emissions coming from the long construction period and from burning fossil fuels until EdF finish it (no track record of delivery) whereas Dogger wind farm will be finished 2026 serving 5% of our needs (SZC 7%) and switching off coal & gas a decade earlier.
@0161Jimmy @BorisJohnson @EnvAgency Thanks Jimmy for your reply. I‚Äôm not convinced that he has  put wealth before Health, as I have always believed he had been led by the Scientists.
